Cache Plugin

The cache provides a way to store temporary files such as cookies or OAUTH2 tokens.

Multiple caches are supported. Each cache can have its own settings, which are persistent and shared among processes. New caches default settings come from the plugin's settings.

Options   Functions   Commands   Other Features

Options

Option Name Type Default Description
dir string "" This is the directory where the cache resides. Leaving it set to "" causes the plugin to search through the jx path (config.path) for the first writable directory, and create a "cache" subdirectory there to store all caches. Usually this works out to be "~/.config/jx/cache/".
seconds number 600 How many seconds to retain cached information. Anything older than this will be discarded. As a special case, setting it to 0 will prevent cached items from ever being discarded due to age.
bytes number 0 Approximate number of bytes that each cache is allowed to use. If a cache grows larger than this, then older items will be deleted to shrink it down. As a special case, settings this to 0 will prevent cached items from ever being discarded due to the cache's overall disk usage.
touch boolean false Normally (when this is false) when looking for older cache items to discard, the module goes by when the item was added to the cache, regardless of how recently the item was retrieved and used again. Setting this to true will change that so the seconds setting is relative to the last use, not when the item was first added to the cache.

Functions

Function Description
cache() Configure a cache, or add/retrieve an item.

Commands

The cache plugin doesn't add any commands.

Other Features

The cache plugin doesn't add any other features.
